description.narrative: The proposed programme primarily aims at improving the living conditions of the population on the both sides of the Nistru river through their mutual cooperation.

participating-org.narrative: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC

activity-description.narrative: The programme aims to contribute to the facilitation of the settlement of the Transnistrian conflict by supporting the increase of confidence between Chisinau and Tiraspol through joint initiatives involving local authorities, civil society organizations and other stakeholders from both sides of the

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: 1. 0 jobs 2. 0 businesses created 3. 55 local communities benefiting from small infrastructure projects supported by CBM since 2009 4. 1. 130 permanent jobs created (at least 40% for women and 50% on the left bank) 2. 12 new businesses created/strengthened (at least 40% by women and 50% on the left bank) 3. 6 new local communities benefiting from small infrastructure projects 4. 10 NGOs and LPAs with improved capacity to implement development projects 5. 4 new joint collaborative infrastructure projects implemented 6. 1 common cultural public events held in or related to historical cultural monuments renovated 7. 600 individuals in the public events for those common cultural events 8. historical cultural heritage related projects realized under the EU cultural heritage funds; proposed 2 9. 8 co-productions produced 10. 5 co- productions /common media projects broadcasted 11. 4 diffusions on prime time of some supported media contents with at least 2 in Transnistrian region

1. 70 jobs (at least 40% for women and 50% on the left bank); 2. 8 new businesses additionally created/ strengthened 3. 8 new local communities benefiting from small infrastructure projects. 4. 190 new local actors with improved capacity for implementing development projects. 5. 6 new collaborative infrastructure projects implemented 6. 4 public events 7. 3400 individuals (disaggregated by gender) 8. 8 projects 9. up to 17 co-productions produced (2019-2021) 10. 5 co-productions /common media projects broadcasted 11. 4 diffusions on prime time of some supported media contents with at least 2 in Transnistrian region

1. Permanent Jobs: - 14 jobs created as a result of the renovated social infrastructure projects, - 93 out of 110 jobs have been created by granted young entrepreneurs - About 600 jobs have been maintained in at least 98 beneficiary MSMEs that avoided bankruptcy and closing, including 21 freelancers that have been involved in diverse Programme activities of MSME support (digital service providers and business consultants). - More than 1000 individuals from both banks have improved their entrepreneurial skills and knowledge through the periodic webinars, Conferences, roundtables, workshops, etc. Temporary Jobs: - 112 Jobs created during the reconstruction works on social infrastructure objects; - 12 jobs created as a result of implementation of small grants. 2. 23 new businesses have been created/strengthened due to implementation of the Start for Youth Plus support programme; (65% owned by women, 100% on left bank). 3. 16 new local communities (7 on right bank and 9 on left bank) benefitting from small infrastructure projects 4. Around 350 NGOs and Professionals are involved in development of their 5 Cross -River Thematic Sectoral platforms, supported by EU CBM 5 grants 5. 14 joint collaborative infrastructure projects implemented 6. Due to COVID limitations, several cultural public events planned to be conducted in Bender fortress had to be rescheduled. Nevertheless, Youth Orchestra managed to conduct “Rock Symphony” Concert in Fortress in summer 2021 during short “green code” window. “Legend of Moldova” Folk Concert that was initially planned for Bender Fortress had to be conducted in Chisinau Green Theater. 8 Theater performances played by Chekhov theater in village Culture Houses renovated by CBM programme on both banks. All together – 13 common cultural events since start of the programme. 7. Despite COVID limitations, over 3 900 individuals (approximately 50% men and 50% women) at 11 various common cultural events 8. 12 (2 Flagship projects and 10 small scale) cultural infrastructure projects under various stages of implementation: • Bender Fortress-technical expertise and detailed design are completed; conservation works started; • Chisinau Circus - technical expertise is completed; design in final stages, tender for restauration works is announced; Small scale projects – 3 are completed; 7 will be realized in 2022; 9. 2 small cultural heritage projects finalized, for other 3 – implementation period was extended to 2022. 10. 15 co-productions broadcasted/ 2 to be broadcasted in 2022. 11. 9 media diffusions on prime time, 4 out of them in Transnistrian region

1. 30 jobs created (at least 40% for women and 50% on the left bank) 2. 12 new businesses additionally created 3. 2 new local communities benefiting from small infrastructure projects 4. 30 new local actors with improved capacity for implementing development projects 5. 1 new collaborative infrastructure projects implemented 6. 3 public events 7. 1000 individuals (disaggregated by gender) 8. 6 projects 9. 0 co-productions produced 10. 3 co-productions /common media projects broadcasted 11. 0 diffusions on prime time of some supported media contents with at least 4 in Transnistrian region
